question: If <katex>$\Delta=\begin{vmatrix} 1 & a & a^2 \\ 1 & b & b^2 \\ 1 & c & c^2 \end{vmatrix}$</katex> and <katex>$\Delta_{1}=\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 \\ bc & ca & ab \\ a & b & c \end{vmatrix}$</katex> then
explanation: In <katex>$\Delta_1$</katex>, multiply R1 by a, R2 by b, R3 by c (actually, manipulate rows/cols). Standard property shows these determinants are related.

The value of <katex>$\Delta_1$</katex> is <katex>$-(a-b)(b-c)(c-a)$</katex> while <katex>$\Delta$</katex> is <katex>$(a-b)(b-c)(c-a)$</katex> (due to row swap operations to match forms). Thus <katex>$\Delta_1 = -\Delta$</katex>.
